@kevinflo how do you handle probe production after two bases?

@courtland:
http://www.teamliquid.net/forum/viewmessage.php?topic_id=188418
Since I only have like 80-90 apm when I'm playing my fastest

@jacob As far as probe production, make sure all your nexuses (nexi?) are hotkeyed to one control group.  I use one.  That way, I just hit 1, then e for however many nexuses each time a round of probes finishes.  The only time I queue is if I use chronoboost for probes in the later stages of the game.  Then I just queue up one extra probe on each nexus I chronoboost since chronoboost lasts as long as it takes to make two probes
@kevinflo my issue is keeping track of the timing of probes coming out
as when it goes to two nexus, i can't see the progress bar unless i go to the nexus and highlight it
to see how close it is to being done

Hmm... I think it's kind of intuition.  I think part of it is that you should keep multiple nexuses fairly synched up as far as their production timing.  By that I mean that when I hit 1 eee (for three nexuses), all three nexuses will finish their probe at the same time.  Past that, I just kind of have an internal feel for how long I should wait between making probes at this point from practice.  By the time you have 3 nexuses up, queueing up another round when the current round is only half over is totally fine unless you're a pro-gamer or something
by that I mean that a little queueing is a-ok
High level gold bc i get cheesed so much QQ
